intro: Quamoclit solanifolia, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant belonging to the Solanaceae family. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its silver-gray leaves and showy, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate in shape and covered in fine, white hairs that give them their distinctive silvery appearance. Quamoclit solanifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
